Title: Associate Media Specialist, APAC (Contract)
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience. 
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
The Associate Media Content Specialist (Contract) on the APAC team will report to the Head of Communications & Channels, APAC. You will manage a variety of operational tasks that ensure our esports and games are successfully published in the region. This covers social and web content operations in collaboration with global teams, regional teams, tournament operators and external agencies to ensure timely content trafficking on respective owned platforms across APAC markets.
You must be highly organized with the ability to juggle multiple projects and stakeholders at once. You will be required to carefully track content timelines to ensure the components necessary to ensure our games and surrounding content reaches players at the right time, and coordinate requirements across both internal teams and external parties.
The position is based in the Singapore hub. Here, youll join a team of internationally and culturally diverse professionals that share our obsession with player experience. Youll join an internationally and culturally diverse team of professionals that share our obsession with player experience. The Singapore hub team oversees the APAC region: Singapore, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Taiwan, Japan and India/South Asia.Please note that Riot Games does not offer relocation packages for this position. You need to be able to work legally in Singapore, without Riot Games sponsorship, to be considered.
Responsibilities:
As Associate Media Specialist, youll contribute to the following areas:

Handle publishing operations processes and execution for esports and games in APAC, which includes our self-published territories, as well as those handled by external publishing partners. 
Manage the housekeeping and operational needs of all active social and web platforms for Riot Games in APAC.
Collaborate with tournament organizers, partners and external agencies to ensure trafficking of content during live broadcasts for esports in APAC.
Communicate proactively, clearly and consistently to ensure transparency and alignment throughout the content publishing cycle, keeping a wide variety of stakeholders consulted and informed on emergent issues or changes.
Contribute to the development of social media content, supporting tasks such as copy editing to ensure a high quality bar of content to excite players and fans.
Identify and implement improvements for our publishing workflow, content management, and how we work with stakeholders.

Required Qualifications:

2+ years experience in social media content or community management.
Eye for QA, spotting, and tackling errors quickly.
Experience in cross-team communication and working with external vendors.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities during high-pressure situations.
Experience with reviewing social assets and vetting English social media copy.
Experience handling confidential information and documents.
Familiarity with social media platforms such as YouTube, TikTok, Twitch, Facebook, Instagram, Discord.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience working with teams on different time zones.
Experience/understanding of APAC, including command of a relevant language, would be a bonus, but not required.
Experience working with web content and Content Management Systems.
Passion for Riots titles and esports is a major plus.

Dont forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications, but well notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously. Visual design creativity / problem solving
Understanding of UI/UX design in games, especially in monetized spaces
Fundamental skills in typography, layout, color, and iconography design.

Experience working with Figma and/or other UI/UX design apps.
Expert knowledge in Adobe CC visual design tools such as Photoshop and Illustrator.
High level or working knowledge of next gen game engines like Unreal, or Unity
Knowledge of game development pipelines, including optimization, localization, and implementation.

Title: Principal Insights Researcher - VALORANT
RoleDescription:
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for gamers around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of gamers is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Principal Researcher, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses that will inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your applied or experimental research background coupled with your deep understanding of data will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As a Principal Researcher reporting to the Senior Manager, Insights on VALORANT, you will be working with product leadership and the broader insights team to tackle complex problem spaces facing the game. On VALORANT, youll be tasked with identifying strategic opportunities and leveraging your expertise in Research to help guide and inform decision making across VALORANT. This role will also be integral in setting the bar for Research within VALORANT and Riot overall as well as mentoring and leveling up junior Researchers on the team.
Responsibilities:

Own highly complex insights workstreams to help illuminate key opportunity areas for VALORANT
Lead multi-modal projects across analytics and research to help answer critical product questions
Construct, organize, and execute studies and surveys across a variety of methods designed to answer business and product strategy questions
Engage with senior leadership to highlight player needs and drive product change through your work
Partner with product leaders to prioritize their efforts - accounting for delivery timelines, revenue impacts, and opportunity costs
Be the research craft expert on VALORANT to help educate and mentor other researchers on the team
Communicate strategic recommendations and product outcomes to business leaders and decision makers
Work collaboratively with a cross functional team of designers, product managers, and engineers
Be an effective advocate for players and provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
Provide strategic insights to test teams assumptions and inform their actions
Share your results with other Rioters in clear, illustrative presentations

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related discipline plus at least 8 years of relevant research experience (an advanced degree can account for 1 to 2 years of experience depending on Masters or PhD) 
Broad experience in quantitative and qualitative research methods including conducting interviews, focus groups, and online community studies, as well as performing survey research with deep expertise in at least one of these areas
3+ years doing research specifically in the games industry 
Experience conducting research to answer product or portfolio strategy questions
Experience synthesizing & socializing research results and distilling results into impactful recommendations for product leadership
Trusted to operate independently regardless of structure and to have owned larger problems/projects/workstreams.

Desired Qualifications:

Familiarity with basic statistical methods for data analysis (regressions, correlations, factor analyses)
Experience working with game teams through the entire lifecycle of the product (development, launch, and live operations) 
Vendor management experience
Experience leading complex efforts with multiple collaborators

Title: Senior Researcher, WR
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience. 
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for players around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Senior Researcher, WR, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses that will inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your applied or experimental research background coupled with your deep understanding of data will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As a Senior Researcher reporting to the Insights Lead on Wild Rift, you will be working across the Dev team, supporting the development of Live Features as well as incubation projects. You will independently identify and execute on research opportunities to support the development of new features or improvement of existing systems -- from prototyping through launch and live service. This role emphasizes a user researcher skillset -- including surveys, player labs, and market research -- to define the why for live and incubating features. If youre looking to leverage your research toolkit and collaborate with designers and product owners to craft resonant multiplatform experiences, this is an excellent opportunity for you.
Responsibilities:

Advise product teams by generating strategic frameworks and insights that guide the development of in-game and around game features for Wild Rift
Design and execute on surveys and player labs in Wild Rifts prioritized markets that support decision making by authentically representing player needs
Conduct global qualitative research and provide actionable guidance for the games team in terms of trends, emerging risks, and opportunities
